intro: Aizoon glabrum, commonly known as the smooth aizoon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces umbellate inflorescences, typical of the family, with small white to greenish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Aizoon glabrum is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
